clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a 13C Glucose Breath Test to Quantify Insulin Resistance in Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus Compared With the Euglycaemic Clamp Test
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a 13C Glucose Breath Test to Quantify Insulin Resistance in Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus Compared With the Euglycaemic Clamp Test

brief_summary.textblock: Insulin resistance can be assessed by the euglycaemic clamp technique. To date, this is the golden standard, but it is not suited for clinical practice. A 13C glucose breath test will be tested as a valid alternative. The curve of the exhaled 13C CO2 as a function of glucose metabolism can be correlated to the curve of the glucose disposal rate obtained via the clamp technique.

detailed_description.textblock:
The hyperinsulinemic-euglycemic clamp technique is the golden standard to assess insulin resistance in type 1 diabetes subjects. The plasma insulin concentration is acutely raised and maintained at 100 Î¼U/ml by a continuous infusion of insulin. Meanwhile, the plasma glucose concentration is held constant at basal levels by a variable glucose infusion. When the steady-state is achieved, the glucose infusion rate equals glucose uptake by all the tissues in the body and is therefore a measure of tissue insulin sensitivity.
These data will be compared with the results of a 13C glucose breath test. Breath tests using 13C substrates are based on the principle that 13C CO2 in the exhaled breath can be measured as a metabolic tracer.
Breath testing has a major advantage over the clamp test in that it can be performed non-invasively and repeatedly without necessary supervision by medical staff.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of the 13C breath test with the golden standard
primary_outcome.description: sensitivity and specificity analysis using linear regression

arm_group.description: Subjects with type 1 diabetes and ultrasound-defined NAFLD
Subjects with type 1 diabetes without ultrasound-defined NAFLD

intervention.description: clamp test (golden standard) to determine insulin resistance
13C glucose breath test to compare with the golden standard

study_pop.textblock: Type 1 diabetes subjects from the research facility's outpatient clinic.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult type 1 diabetes patients
- 25/50 subjects with confirmed NAFLD (using ultrasound criteria)
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- gastric bypass surgery
- cirrhosis
- secondary cause of liver steatosis present
- any cause which makes a 4-hour clamp impossible
